perturbation.original_text: Licensee shall use with the Brand any applicable trademark notices as may be requested by Licensor or required under applicable laws, regulations, stock exchange and other rules (“Laws”) and reputable industry practice.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee shall use with the Brand any applicable trademark notices as may be requested by Licensor.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the phrase "or required under applicable laws, regulations, stock exchange and other rules ('Laws') and reputable industry practice" creates an omission. This may result in failure to adhere to trademark laws. While the Licensor may request compliance, if they do not, the Licensee is not obligated to follow the laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Trademark Law (Lanham Act) and state trademark laws require proper trademark notices.

perturbation.original_text: THIS AGREEMENT SHALL BE GOVERNED BY, AND CONSTRUED AND INTERPRETED IN ACCORDANCE WITH, THE LAW OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK. EACH OF THE PARTIES IRREVOCABLY AND UNCONDITIONALLY SUBMITS TO THE EXCLUSIVE JURISDICTION OF THE STATE AND FEDERAL COURTS LOCATED IN NEW YORK CITY FOR THE PURPOSE OF ANY ACTION RELATING TO OR ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT.
perturbation.changed_text: THIS AGREEMENT SHALL BE GOVERNED BY, AND CONSTRUED AND INTERPRETED IN ACCORDANCE WITH, THE LAW OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the clause about submitting to the exclusive jurisdiction of New York courts creates an omission. While New York law governs the agreement, it is essential to have a jurisdiction clause to resolve disputes. Without this clause, enforcing the agreement can become complex and costly, as parties may dispute the proper venue. This impacts dispute resolution.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law favoring clear jurisdiction clauses.

perturbation.original_text: EACH PARTY HEREBY IRREVOCABLY AND UNCONDITIONALLY WAIVES TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, ANY RIGHT SUCH PARTY MAY HAVE TO A TRIAL BY JURY IN RESPECT TO ANY ACTION RELATING TO OR ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the entire jury trial waiver, we remove a legally significant provision. Parties have a constitutional right to a jury trial, but can waive it by contract. Omitting this clause means any dispute will default to a jury trial, potentially increasing the cost and time involved in litigation. This contradicts the common practice of sophisticated parties agreeing to bench trials for complex commercial matters.
perturbation.contradicted_law: 7th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution (right to jury trial) and state equivalents.
